description: (T1) Lime (Tilia cordata) TPO- reduce crown by 30% (2m) to suitable growth points- reduce lateral branches on outbound side to re-balance tree (previous pruning caused unbalance to reduce seasonal aphid droppings over car parking area)- remove any epicormic and basal growthRETAINED HEIGHT - 7mRETAINED SPREAD - 4m(T2) Small Horse Chestnut (Aeschylus hippocastrum) TPO- reduce crown by 25%(1.3m) to suitable growth points- reduce lateral branch length to match shape and balanceRETAINED HEIGHT - 8mRETAINED SPREAD - 4.5m(T3) Large Horse Chestnut (Aeschylus hippocastrum) CA- reduce crown by 25% (2.5m) to suitable growth points- reduce lateral branch length to match (2.5m) shape and balance with emphasis on outbound side. to reduce weight on north facing sideRETAINED HEIGHT - 14mRETAINED SPREAD - 10m(T4) Ash (Fraxinus excelsior) CA- cut back 2x branches overhanging clients' garage roof at suitable branch unions as discussedall works for routine maintenance
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
